questions.question: How does CrossSend work?
questions.answer: CrossSend creates a temporary web server on your device that other devices on the same network can connect to using a web browser.

questions.question: Is my data secure when using CrossSend?
questions.answer: Yes. All transfers happen only on your local network and the data never passes through any external servers.

questions.question: Do I need to create an account?
questions.answer: No. CrossSend doesn't require any accounts, registration, or personal information.

questions.question: Which file types can I share?
questions.answer: You can share virtually any file type, including documents, images, videos, audio files, and more.

questions.question: Is there a file size limit?
questions.answer: There's no inherent file size limit in CrossSend. The only limitation is the available storage on your devices and the speed of your local network.

questions.question: Can I use CrossSend across different platforms?
questions.answer: Yes! CrossSend is designed to work across iOS, Android, Windows, macOS, and Linux. The receiving device only needs a modern web browser.

sections.title: Devices can't connect
steps: Make sure all devices are connected to the same local network
Check if any firewall or security software might be blocking connections
Verify that the receiving device has a modern, updated web browser

sections.title: Slow transfer speeds
steps: Move devices closer to your WiFi router
Reduce network congestion by disconnecting unused devices
Consider using a wired connection if possible
Check if your router supports 5GHz connections for faster speeds

sections.title: App crashes or freezes
steps: Update to the latest version of CrossSend
If problems persist, contact our support team with details about your device and OS
